page.title: 02NATURE RESERVES
page.content: Lindisfarne is a National Nature Reserve and is looked after by the Nature Conservancy Council.There are wintering birds,passage birds and breeding birds.There are Brent Geese,Lapwings,Skylarks,Eiders, Shelducks,Mallards and Gulls. Winter visitors include Whooper Swans from Iceland,huge flocks of Wigeon,and waders like Dunlin,Knot, Godwit,Golden Plover,Curlew, Oystercatcher,and Redshank. Seals come close to the shore at Cove's Harbour,basking on the rocks. Many rabbits breed in the dunes.
